verses.kjv: Woe to her that is filthy and polluted, to the oppressing city!
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for the rebellious, defiled city — the city that oppresses its people!

verses.kjv: She obeyed not the voice; she received not correction; she trusted not in the LORD; she drew not near to her God.
verses.ct: She refused to listen to anyone. She rejected correction. She did not trust in the LORD. She did not come close to her God.

verses.kjv: Her princes within her are roaring lions; her judges are evening wolves; they gnaw not the bones till the morrow.
verses.ct: Her leaders within her are roaring lions. Her judges are wolves that hunt at evening — they leave nothing by morning.

verses.kjv: Her prophets are light and treacherous persons: her priests have polluted the sanctuary, they have done violence to the law.
verses.ct: Her prophets are reckless and disloyal. Her priests have desecrated the sanctuary and twisted the law.

verses.kjv: The just LORD is in the midst thereof; he will not do iniquity: every morning doth he bring his judgment to light, he faileth not; but the unjust knoweth no shame.
verses.ct: Yet the righteous LORD is right there among them. He does no wrong. Every morning he brings his justice to light, and he never fails. But the wicked feel no shame at all.

verses.kjv: I have cut off the nations: their towers are desolate; I made their streets waste, that none passeth by: their cities are destroyed, so that there is no man, that there is none inhabitant.
verses.ct: "I have destroyed nations; their fortresses are in ruins. I have emptied their streets so that no one walks through them. Their cities are demolished, with no one left — not a single person living in them."

verses.kjv: I said, Surely thou wilt fear me, thou wilt receive instruction; so their dwelling should not be cut off, howsoever I punished them: but they rose early, and corrupted all their doings.
verses.ct: "I thought, 'Surely now you will deeply revere me and accept my correction.' Then their homes would not have been torn down, despite all the ways I disciplined them. But instead, they got up early and made all their actions even more corrupt."

verses.kjv: Therefore wait ye upon me, saith the LORD, until the day that I rise up to the prey: for my determination is to gather the nations, that I may assemble the kingdoms, to pour upon them mine indignation, even all my fierce anger: for all the earth shall be devoured with the fire of my jealousy.
verses.ct: "So wait for me," declares the LORD, "until the day I rise up to take action. For I have decided to gather the nations and assemble the kingdoms, to pour out my fury on them — all of my burning anger. The entire earth will be consumed by the fire of my jealousy."

verses.kjv: For then will I turn to the people a pure language, that they may all call upon the name of the LORD, to serve him with one consent.
verses.ct: "At that time I will give the peoples purified speech, so that all of them may call on the name of the LORD and serve him together in unity."

verses.kjv: From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia my suppliants, even the daughter of my dispersed, shall bring mine offering.
verses.ct: "From beyond the rivers of Ethiopia, my worshipers — my scattered people — will bring their offerings to me."

verses.kjv: In that day shalt thou not be ashamed for all thy doings, wherein thou hast transgressed against me: for then I will take away out of the midst of thee them that rejoice in thy pride, and thou shalt no more be haughty because of my holy mountain.
verses.ct: "On that day you will no longer be ashamed of all the things you did when you rebelled against me, because I will remove from among you those who are arrogant and boastful. You will never again act proudly on my holy mountain."

verses.kjv: I will also leave in the midst of thee an afflicted and poor people, and they shall trust in the name of the LORD.
verses.ct: "I will leave among you a humble and lowly people, and they will put their trust in the name of the LORD."

verses.kjv: The remnant of Israel shall not do iniquity, nor speak lies; neither shall a deceitful tongue be found in their mouth: for they shall feed and lie down, and none shall make them afraid.
verses.ct: "The remnant of Israel will not do wrong or tell lies. No deceptive words will come from their mouths. They will eat and rest peacefully, and no one will frighten them."

verses.kjv: Sing, O daughter of Zion; shout, O Israel; be glad and rejoice with all the heart, O daughter of Jerusalem.
verses.ct: Sing out, daughter of Zion! Shout with joy, Israel! Celebrate and rejoice with all your heart, daughter of Jerusalem!

verses.kjv: The LORD hath taken away thy judgments, he hath cast out thine enemy: the king of Israel, even the LORD, is in the midst of thee: thou shalt not see evil any more.
verses.ct: The LORD has removed the judgments against you and driven out your enemies. The king of Israel — the LORD himself — is among you. You will never experience disaster again.

verses.kjv: In that day it shall be said to Jerusalem, Fear thou not: and to Zion, Let not thine hands be slack.
verses.ct: On that day it will be said to Jerusalem, "Don't be afraid!" And to Zion, "Don't let your hands hang limp with discouragement."

verses.kjv: The LORD thy God in the midst of thee is mighty; he will save, he will rejoice over thee with joy; he will rest in his love, he will joy over thee with singing.
verses.ct: The LORD your God is among you — he is mighty and he will save you. He will take great delight in you. He will quiet you with his love. He will celebrate over you with singing.

verses.kjv: I will gather them that are sorrowful for the solemn assembly, who are of thee, to whom the reproach of it was a burden.
verses.ct: "I will gather those among you who grieve over the loss of your sacred festivals — those for whom the disgrace of exile has been a heavy burden."

verses.kjv: Behold, at that time I will undo all that afflict thee: and I will save her that halteth, and gather her that was driven out; and I will get them praise and fame in every land where they have been put to shame.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — at that time I will deal with everyone who has oppressed you. I will rescue the one who is lame and bring back the one who was scattered. I will turn their shame into praise and fame throughout every land where they were humiliated."

verses.kjv: At that time will I bring you again, even in the time that I gather you: for I will make you a name and a praise among all people of the earth, when I turn back your captivity before your eyes, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: "At that time I will bring you home. When I gather you together, I will give you honor and praise among all the peoples of the earth, when I restore your fortunes right before your eyes," declares the LORD.
